item.title: French prisons hit by wave of overnight attacks
item.description: Vehicles were set on fire in prison car parks outside several prisons across the country.

item.title: Trump blames Zelensky for starting war after massive Russian attack
item.description: The US president said that you "don't start a war against someone 20 times your size" and hope people give you missiles.

item.title: Trump freezes $2bn in Harvard funding after university rejects demands
item.description: The White House sent a sweeping list of requirements to the university last week, which it said were aimed at fighting antisemitism.

item.title: The Taliban banned Afghan girls from school. Low-paid carpet weaving is now their lifeline
item.description: The BBC speaks to young women who are now working to support their families in one of few jobs they are allowed to do.

item.title: Sudan's years of war - BBC smuggles in phones to reveal hunger and fear
item.description: Rare accounts of life in el-Fasher - the last major city in Darfur controlled by the Sudanese army.
